content.description:
Sit start from back all the way under the boulder start hold on the large jug about two feet off the ground, then go out to two pretty bad crimpers, just little cracks in the rock.  Dyno to another pretty good crimper and go from there. V6- Variation: start on the two bad crimpers.

WARNING: There is a large jug at the bottom left of the route, it's a flake about one and a half square feet, really close to the two bad beginning crimpers. IT'S LOOSE and just leaning against the tree next to it.  It's not recommended that you touch it :)
content.location: About 60-100 feet north from the very first rock outcropping. Directly to the left of a big ledge to climb down after topping out.

content.description:
This rock has a strong overhang.  Its short, but angles make it tough.  Watch out for the tree behind you, hence the name.

Crux is making a high left after bumping 3 times on the right.
content.location: If facing the set of long boulders in this wall, head right about 150-200 yards.

content.description: Crux is the start, the lower you are the harder.  There is only one really good hold on the right above the crux and you have to bump to it, hence the difficulty with the lower start.  Stay on the corner and reach for ledges.  All holds are pretty big and easy to grab, just a little reachy.  Top out to finish.  V1 for taller people, V2 for shorter.  Pretty fun though and on a beautiful piece of rock.
content.location: Located about 80ft off the trail behind some laurels.  This section of the wall is a piece of beautifully smooth feldspar with bands of pink and white quartz running through it.
